t: Tesla Is #1 Brand By LGBT Consumers
s: August 7, 2016 - This year, Tesla took the number one spot on YouGov's Best Brand 2015 for lesbian, gay, bi-sexual, and transgender consumers (LGBT). The company won by a long shot and knocked Amazon out of first place. Tesla was not on the list top ten list last year.

t: Amazon Is Proud to Celebrate Pride Month - Amazon Jobs
s: No matter how you identify, or who you love, you can find a place here — at an Amazon Warehouse. t: Pride Month 2025 Collections From Companies That Give Back to the LGBTQIA+ Community: Clothing, Shoes and More Products With Purpose
s: 1 day ago - Knockaround’s Pride Collection 2025 celebrates individuality while supporting LGBTQ+ youth through its ongoing partnership with The Trevor Project. Featuring rainbow-themed sunglasses and vibrant towels, the collection embodies self-expression. Prices range from $10 to $180 on knockaround.com. How it supports the LGBTQ+ community: The brand is supporting mental health initiatives by donating $5 from every ...

t: Pride at AWS | Amazon.jobs
s: Pride Month is a global celebration of love and equality — and we’re proud to celebrate at AWS! At a time when some want to silence certain voices, we’re turning up the volume to shout the praises and share the stories of some of our amazing LGBTQIA+ builders.

t: Is Amazon really LGBTQ friendly? - Choose Because
s: In 2022, Seattle Pride will not allow Amazon to fund LGBTQ pride activities. The Seattle-based group, which hosts pride events and engages in other campaigning, announced Tuesday that it would “part ways” with Amazon

t: Amazon.com: LGBT Pride Clothing: Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry

t: 35 Pride products from brands that actually give back to the LGBTQ+ community
s: June 20, 2024 - Pura Vida's Pride collection features a variety of gorgeous bracelets, rings, necklaces, and earrings, with all sorts of designs that signify and celebrate different aspects of the LGBTQ+ community. For every bracelet sold, Pura Vida will donate 5 percent of the purchase price to The Trevor Project.

t: Seattle Pride drops Amazon as a sponsor of city's LGBTQ parade
s: The e-commerce giant wanted the annual march to be renamed "Seattle Pride Parade Presented by Amazon," according to the nonprofit group's executive director.

t: Amazon Restricts L.G.B.T.Q. Products in United Arab Emirates - The New York Times
s: June 29, 2022 - Sales of items including flags and books were blocked in the country, where homosexuality is criminalized.

t: Amazon | Marketing the Rainbow
